[Learn more](https://policies.google.com/technologies/cookies) Ok, Got it This diagnostic detects when the `.px`, `.%`, and `.em` suffixes are used with an attribute binding. ``` ``` check ## [What's wrong with that?](https://angular.dev/extended-diagnostics/NG8106\#whats-wrong-with-that) These suffixes are only available for style bindings. They do not have any meaning when binding to an attribute. ## [What should I do instead?](https://angular.dev/extended-diagnostics/NG8106\#what-should-i-do-instead) Rather than using the `.px`, `.%`, or `.em` suffixes that are only supported in style bindings, move this to the value assignment of the binding. ``` ``` check ## [Configuration requirements](https://angular.dev/extended-diagnostics/NG8106\#configuration-requirements) [`strictTemplates`](https://angular.dev/extended-diagnostics/tools/cli/template-typecheck#strict-mode) must be enabled for any extended diagnostic to emit. `suffixNotSupported` has no additional requirements beyond `strictTemplates`. ## [What if I can't avoid this?](https://angular.dev/extended-diagnostics/NG8106\#what-if-i-cant-avoid-this) This diagnostic can be disabled by editing the project's `tsconfig.json` file: ``` { "angularCompilerOptions": { "extendedDiagnostics": { "checks": { "suffixNotSupported": "suppress" } } }} ``` check See [extended diagnostic configuration](https://angular.dev/extended-diagnostics/extended-diagnostics#configuration) for more info.
